alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:46PM PST until January 10 at 5:30PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lingering flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall and additional showers continuing into Tuesday morning. * WHERE...A large portion of southwest California, including the following counties, western Los Angeles, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara, and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring and will continue. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. Local media have reported water rescues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM PST, local law enforcement reported widespread flooding continuing across the warned area from earlier heavy rain. Scattered moderate showers will prolong the flooding risk through the overnight hours into Tuesday morning. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in many areas, except upwards of over a foot of rain over the higher terrain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Camarillo, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Fillmore, Malibu, Pismo Beach, Ojai, Montecito, Santa Ynez, Point Conception, Agoura Hills, Chatsworth and Woodland Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
